name: Angular Timespan
tagline: Simple directive to get human readable timespans from any two dates
body: ## Install ```bash bower install angular-timespan ``` Or download the [full file](https://github.com/aurbano/angular-timespan/blob/master/dist/angular-timespan.js) or the [minified version](https://github.com/aurbano/angular-timespan/blob/master/dist/angular-timespan.min.js) from the [dist folder](https://github.com/aurbano/angular-timespan/tree/master/dist). Then include the file in your application (adding the script tag, using require... ) and add it to your app: ```js angular.module('myApp',[ 'aurbano.timespan' // ... ].run([ /* ... */ ]); ``` ## Usage Add the directive with the difference between any two dates to get them in a readable manner: ```html Sent ago. Sent 14 days ago ``` Where dateDiff is the difference in milliseconds: `$scope.dateDiff = new Date() - startDate;` ## Options You can specify `timespan-opts` with an object containing the custom settings you want for the timespan display: ```html Sent ago. ``` And in your controller: ```js $scope.timespanConfig = { lessThanFirst: 'now', // What to display if the diff is less than the first available unit millisecond: 'ms', // ------------------------------------ second: 's', // minute: 'm', // hour: 'h', // Labels for each unit, use them for day: 'd', // shorthand units, localization... week: 'w', // Set any to `false` to disable it month: 'mo', // year: 'y', // ------------------------------------ space: false, // Whether to add a space between the number and the label pluralize: false // Whether to add an 's' to the label if the diff > 1 }; ``` ## Contribute Feel free to submit any issues or modifications in Pull Requests. If you are adding a feature it would be great if you also documented it in the Readme, or at least in the PR comment. ## License This directive is released under the [MIT License](https://github.com/aurbano/angular-timespan/blob/master/LICENSE)
